conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and deceleration/acceleration intervals.
The graph is symmetric about a vertical dashed line.
Motion up to the dashed line is mirrored after the dashed line.
For time interval 0 to t1, the graph shows deceleration followed by acceleration.
Before the dashed line, the particle decelerates; after, it accelerates.
Particle's velocity at corresponding times before and after the dashed line are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction.
Particle passes through a position three times by moving back and forth.
Three positions coincide with points of symmetrical velocity.
Scenario 1: Moves forward, decelerates to zero, reverses, returns, and accelerates forward.
Scenario 2: Moves forward, decelerates, stops, reverses, passes position twice, then accelerates through again.
Particle's velocity changes sign, indicating direction reversal.
Given symmetry and velocity changes, particle returns to the same position multiple times within interval 0 to t1.
Final Answer: Particle moves forward, decelerates to stop, reverses, returns, and accelerates forward, passing the same position three times.
